Class TestBedMain

java.lang.Object
application.TestBedMain
public class TestBedMain extends Object

Title: TestBedMain Class.

Description: A Java implementation for semi-automated tests for the Answer class

Copyright: Matthew Thomas Brummund Â© 2025

Version:
1.00 2025-03-26 A set of semi-automated test cases for the Answer and class
Author:
Matthew Thomas Brummund

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      This mainline displays a header to the console, performs a sequence of test cases, and then displays a footer with a summary of the results
      Parameters:
      args - Command line arguments (not used)

    • performTestCaseSetText

      private static void performTestCaseSetText(int testCase, String inputText, boolean expectedPass)
      This method implements a testcase for the getText Method in the Answer class. The purpose of the method is to set the answer text if needed, and here this is implemented. The test works by displaying the header, doing the test, and then interpreting and displaying the results.
      Parameters:
      testCase - The test case number for reporting purposes
      inputText - The text to set for the answer
      expectedPass - Whether the test is expected to pass or fail

    • performTestCaseUpvote

      private static void performTestCaseUpvote(int testCase, int numUpvotes, boolean expectedPass)
      This method sets up everything needed to test the upvotes method, and then tests it. It does this through displaying the header, testing, interpreting and displaying the results.
      Parameters:
      testCase - The test case number for reporting purposes
      numUpvotes - The number of times to upvote the answer
      expectedPass - Whether the test is expected to pass or fail

    • performTestCaseDownvote

      private static void performTestCaseDownvote(int testCase, int numdownvotes, boolean expectedPass)
      This method sets up everything needed to test the downvote method, and then tests it. It does this through displaying the header, testing, interpreting and displaying the results.
      Parameters:
      testCase - The test case number for reporting purposes
      numdownvotes - The number of times to downvote the answer
      expectedPass - Whether the test is expected to pass or fail

    • performTestCaseMarkAsCorrect

      private static void performTestCaseMarkAsCorrect(int testCase, Boolean correct, boolean expectedPass)
      This method sets up an answer and sets it as correct or not based on the input. Then it will check if the correct value has been assigned to the answer. Lastly it will do all of this through displaying a header, interpreting the results, and displaying them.
      Parameters:
      testCase - The test case number for reporting purposes
      correct - Whether the answer should be marked as correct
      expectedPass - Whether the test is expected to pass or fail

    • performTestCaseSetAnsweredBy

      private static void performTestCaseSetAnsweredBy(int testCase, String userName, boolean expectedPass)
      This method sets up the value to have as the username, and assigns it to an example answer. It will then check if the assigned username was the correct one, and if so then it will display the output in the correct way.
      Parameters:
      testCase - The test case number for reporting purposes
      userName - The username to set for the answer
      expectedPass - Whether the test is expected to pass or fail
